title: ajanwalker
author: ajanwalker
created_time: December 18, 2022, 04:44:27 PMLast edit: December 20, 2022, 08:53:42 AM by ajanwalker
content: Alexis Mac Allister from Argentina, the football player who marked the world cup and came to the fore. He plays for Brighton have Albion in England, but I think he will go to big clubs during the interim transfer period or at the end of the year at the latest.And Enner Valencia from Ecuador drew attention. If Ecuador had seen further tours we would have heard more of it.Croatia goal keeper, Livakovic Are there any football players or players that caught your attention?

comments.author: qory
comments.body: It is striking that a player from that team managed to make it to the national team of Argentina. Wouldn't that normally be way too high? He certainly hasn't played badly, but I doubt he can make a move to a really top team in the Premier league. There are still a number of players from Argentina who play in lower divisions but do play in the national team. There are more examples of this in other countries as well. Now it is time to focus again on the European Championship in 2024.

comments.author: alegotardo
comments.body: Quote from: ajanwalker on December 18, 2022, 04:44:27 PMAlexis Mac Allister from Argentina, the football player who marked the world cup and came to the fore. He plays for Brighton have Albion in England, but I think he will go to big clubs during the interim transfer period or at the end of the year at the latest.And Enner Valencia from Ecuador drew attention. If Ecuador had seen further tours we would have heard more of it.Hırvatistan goal keeper, Livakovic Are there any football players or players that caught your attention?We certainly need to remember logero Bono from MoroccoA true "wall" that greatly benefited Morocco and helped them reach the quarterfinals. We know that his participation in the World Cup was one of the great assets for his team to get so far in the competition. The Morocco goalkeeper only conceded three goals, one of which was an own goal.Bono has already been named man of the match twice in the elimination phase, and in the round of 16 the goalkeeper was one of those responsible for preventing Spain from scoring, guaranteeing a place in the quarterfinals. Do you remember that he took two of the three penalties beaten by the Spaniards? The guy is a very good goalkeeper, the best I've ever seen in this cup.And in the Portugal game, the goalkeeper was a "wall" against the opponents, preventing the Portuguese team from scoring their goal several times.It is for these reasons that I believe he should be recognized and named as one of the best players in this world cup.

comments.author: trendcoin
comments.body: I really liked Sofiane Boufal and Izzeddin Unahi's performances. I don't think they can stay in Angers any longer. They are very likely to make a good transfer in the winter transfer window or at the end of the season. I also liked Amrabat's performance very much. There were talented football players in Morocco that stood out. The transfer fees of Boufal and Unahi may be at reasonable levels, but the numbers spoken for Amrabat are very high.Also, I really enjoyed watching Mohammed Kudus from Ghana. He has the potential to mark the coming years. He could have a career that will escalate the Mbappe and Haaland rivalry.

comments.author: pungopete468
comments.body: Morocco's player has played a very strong tournament. And against all the strong countries, Morocco really played to win. Morocco's gesture was beautiful when they eliminated Spain in the dressing room towards Nouri, a young player who suffered from a heart problem and will probably never walk or talk again. You don't see other teams doing that very often. Morocco's team spirit has also ensured that they have come this far. Kudus hasn't been able to show enough because Ghana as a country just wasn't strong enough to get through. I haven't spotted many real talents, but Gvardiol from Croatia has made an impression and Morocco also had 2 midfielders very strong. A nice transfer awaits them.

comments.author: rahmad2nd
comments.body: Alexis Mac allister, he earned his place as this player after what he showed during the Mexico match. after this match, he became the main starting and his role as a midfielder really deserves appreciation. he was also able to contribute one goal for his national team, during the match versus Poland. his performance was unstable during the match vs Croatia, and in the end Scaloni withdrew him who replaced him with A. Correa. in the final match vs France, he really appeared extraordinary, his enthusiasm was tireless. and he contributed an assist, which was continued by D Maria to make it the second goal for Argentina. he deserves to be given the stage to play in a bigger team.Ernest Valensia, this Ecuadorian player. his appearance is truly extraordinary, even though he has entered 33 years of age. but his contribution to Ecuador deserves a thumbs up and he has scored three goals. unfortunately, in the last match against Senegal, his condition had gotten injured before.For goalkeepers, besides Livakovic, Bono, Andries Noppert must also be appreciated. yes he is the goalkeeper of the Dutch national team.  and one more, Emeliano Martinez, absolutely brilliant.Another one, one of the young strikers owned by Portugal. Two of his goals came against Poland, two against Danmark, and one against Australia. And in the final, although he scored one goal by himself the other two came from penalty kicks. I thought that although he received the golden boot, there was nothing special in his performance this time. For comparison, I would rate Julián Álvarez ahead of him.

Look at this comparison between Martinez and Livakovic:So do you agree that Martinez deserved a golden glove reward as the best goalkeeper on the tournament?Haven't checked the stats of the two at the World Cup but seeing what you're showing it honestly has to be said that Livakovic deserved much more and the difference is vast and it's become quite puzzling why with such disparate statistics the organizers didn't award the Croatian goalkeeper a golden glove. Being able to bring Argentina to win the World Cup should not be a reason for giving it because appearance should be the benchmark for judging this is quite disappointing and suspicious.
